newsitem.title: UK: European jet fuel dips with futures, market slow.
newsitem.headline: European jet fuel dips with futures, market slow.

text.p: European jet fuel was a touch easier on Tuesday as weaker futures eroded gains made yesterday. Premiums were broadly steady in a market characterised as thin.
May IPE gas oil was trading $1.75 a tonne lower at $163.50 at 1630 GMT.
Traders said barge premiums were holding steady at around May IPE gas oil +$18 fob ARA while cargo premiums were pegged around +$24 cif NWE.
"It is pretty quiet, no one looks under pressure to do much," said one trader.
In the Mediterranean sellers were reluctant to drop their prices much below fob high quotes +$10 against buyers several dollars adrift.
"Buyers see better supplies in May, so are not going to buy unless they need to," said one trader.
